entry.content:
Being a freelancer means juggling time, clients, and cash flow. These 5 tools can help you get more done — and grow your income.

---

## 1. Toggl Track – Time Tracking  
Track every billable second. Beautiful reports, easy client invoicing.

## 2. Notion – All-in-One Workspace  
Organize tasks, projects, and client briefs in one place.

## 3. Fiverr Workspace – Contracts & Invoicing  
Create smart contracts, send branded invoices, get paid faster.

## 4. Loom – Video Explainers  
Quickly record and send feedback, tutorials, or client walkthroughs.

## 5. Wise – Global Payments  
Receive and send money with low fees and excellent exchange rates.

---

🧠 **Pro Tip:** Focus on tools that save *at least 5 hours/week* or help generate new income. Replace/upgrade as you grow.

entry.content:
🚀 **Want to get more done in less time?**  
These tools help freelancers automate repetitive work and focus on what matters most.

---

### 1. **Notion** – Organize your tasks, notes, and workflows  
🧠 Perfect for planning client projects and tracking deliverables.

### 2. **Zapier** – Automate tedious tasks  
🔗 Connect apps like Gmail, Trello, Google Sheets without code.

### 3. **Clockify** – Time tracking made simple  
⏱️ Bill clients accurately by tracking hours.

### 4. **Canva Pro** – Design anything fast  
🎨 Quickly create graphics, invoices, and proposals.

### 5. **Bonsai** – Contracts, invoices & payments  
📄 All-in-one platform for freelancers to stay professional.

---

💡 **Stack these tools** to save 5–10 hours every week.
